original: (d) Board Policies and Procedures . The Investor Group acknowledges that each of the New Directors shall be required to comply with all policies, processes, procedures, codes, rules, standards, and guidelines applicable to members of the Board, as in effect from time to time, including, but not limited to, the Company’s Code of Conduct, and policies on confidentiality, ethics, hedging and pledging of Company securities, public disclosures, stock trading, and stock ownership, and that each of the New Directors shall be required to strictly preserve the confidentiality of Company business and information, including the discussion of any matters considered in meetings of the Board whether or not the matters relate to material non-public information, unless previously publicly disclosed by the Company . Further, the Investor Group acknowledges that the New Directors will be requested to provide the Company with such information as is reasonably requested by the Company concerning the New Directors as is required to be disclosed under applicable law or stock exchange regulations, including the completion of the Company’s standard director and officer questionnaire, in each case as promptly as necessary to enable the timely filing of the Company’s proxy statement and other periodic reports with the SEC.
ollama_generated:
(d) Compliance with Board Regulations: The Investor Group acknowledges that each of the New Directors understands and accepts their responsibility to adhere to all policies, processes, procedures, codes, rules, standards, and guidelines applicable to members of the Board, as they may be amended from time to time. This includes, but is not limited to, the Company’s Code of Conduct, policies on confidentiality, ethics, hedging and pledging of Company securities, public disclosures, stock trading, and stock ownership. Each New Director agrees to maintain strict confidentiality regarding Company business and information, including discussions of any matters considered during Board meetings, whether or not they pertain to material non-public information, unless such information has already been publicly disclosed by the Company.

However, it is important to note that while the Investor Group acknowledges that the New Directors may be requested to provide the Company with certain information as required by applicable law or stock exchange regulations, such as completing the Company’s standard director and officer questionnaire, this information provision is solely at the discretion of each New Director. The timely filing of the Company's proxy statement and other periodic reports with the SEC shall not be delayed due to any such information request made to a New Director.

original: 5. Representations and Warranties of the Company . The Company represents and warrants to the Investors that (a) the Company has the corporate power and authority to execute this Agreement and to bind it thereto, (b) this Agreement has been duly and validly authorized, executed and delivered by the Company, constitutes a valid and binding obligation and agreement of the Company, and is enforceable against the Company in accordance with its terms, except as enforcement thereof may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, fraudulent conveyance or similar laws generally affecting the rights of creditors and subject to general equity principles and (c) the execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement by the Company does not and will not violate or conflict with (i) any law, rule, regulation, order, judgment or decree applicable to it, or (ii) result in any breach or violation of or constitute a default (or an event which with notice or lapse of time or both could become a default) under or pursuant to, or result in the loss of a material benefit under, or give any right of termination, amendment, acceleration or cancellation of, any organizational document, or any material agreement, contract, commitment, understanding or arrangement to which the Company is a party or by which it is bound.
ollama_generated: 5. Representation and Warranties by the Company to the Investors: The Company warrants and represents to the Investors that (a) the Company possesses the necessary corporate power and authorization to execute this Agreement, binding itself thereto, (b) this Agreement has been duly and validly authorized, executed, and delivered by the Company, and is a legally enforceable obligation and agreement, though its enforcement may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, fraudulent conveyance, or similar laws affecting creditor rights, subject to general equity principles, (c) the execution, delivery, and performance of this Agreement by the Company do not and will not violate any law, rule, regulation, order, judgment, or decree applicable to it, nor will they result in any breach or violation of, or default (or an event that with notice or lapse of time or both could become a default) under, or cause the loss of a material benefit under, or provide any right for termination, amendment, acceleration, or cancellation of, any organizational document, material agreement, contract, commitment, understanding, or arrangement to which the Company is a party or is bound, except as such violations, breaches, defaults, or losses may be inadvertent and remedied upon prompt notice.

7. Limited Right to Express Concerns:

Each Party acknowledges the right to raise legitimate concerns about the other's performance or compliance with this Agreement, provided such expression is made in a professional and respectful manner and does not undermine the other Party's reputation or business interests beyond what is necessary to address the concern. The Parties agree to engage in good faith discussions to resolve any such issues promptly.

original: The Company shall provide the Investor Group and its counsel a reasonable opportunity to review and comment on the Form 8-K prior to such filing, which comments shall be considered in good faith.
ollama_generated: The Investor Group and their counsel shall have the right to request a reasonable timeframe for review and comment on the Form 8-K, but the Company is under no obligation to alter its filing plans based on such feedback, unless it is deemed necessary in good faith.

Upon the Occurrence of Obligations to the Recipient (hereinafter "Recipient"):

The Corporation (hereinafter "Corporation") shall not be required to perform any duties or actions beyond those explicitly stated in this Agreement, unless such additional obligations are mutually agreed upon in writing by both parties. In the event that further obligations arise due to circumstances outside of the control of the Corporation, including but not limited to changes in applicable laws and regulations, the Recipient shall bear the responsibility for any associated costs or consequences arising therefrom. The Corporation shall endeavor to comply with its existing obligations, but any delay or failure to do so shall not constitute a breach of this Agreement, unless such delay or failure has been caused by the intentional wrongdoing of the Corporation or gross negligence in the performance of its duties under this Agreement.

modified:
The Reciprocal Party (hereinafter "Reciprocal"), acknowledges and agrees that any and all liabilities, claims, actions, or damages arising from or relating to the use of the services provided by The Meet Group, Inc. (hereinafter "The Meet Group") shall be solely and exclusively its own responsibility and liability. The Reciprocal hereby indemnifies, holds harmless, and defends The Meet Group from any such claims, actions, or damages that may arise during the term of this agreement.

In essence, while the original clause placed the obligation on The Meet Group to handle liabilities arising from its services, this revised clause shifts that responsibility onto the Reciprocal party, who agrees to indemnify and hold harmless The Meet Group from such claims, actions, or damages.

original: 18. Waiver.  No failure on the part of any party to exercise, and no delay in exercising, any right, power or remedy hereunder shall operate as a waiver thereof, nor shall any single or partial exercise of such right, power or remedy by such party preclude any other or further exercise thereof or the exercise of any other right, power or remedy.
ollama_generated: 18. Waiver and Limitation. Any forbearance or failure to enforce a provision herein shall not be construed as a waiver of such provision or any other part of this agreement. Moreover, the exercise of any rights, powers, or remedies shall not restrict or limit the right to exercise any other or further rights, powers, or remedies in the future, or the ability to enforce any other provision of this agreement.

original: 19. Remedies.  All remedies hereunder are cumulative and are not exclusive of any other remedies provided by law or equity.
ollama_generated:
19. Remedies. The remedies set forth herein are neither limiting nor exhaustive, and do not supersede or diminish any rights or remedies available under applicable law or equity.

Explanation: This revised clause weakens the original by stating that the provided remedies are neither exclusive (meaning there may be other remedies) nor limiting (meaning they do not constitute all possible remedies). Additionally, it clarifies that these contractual remedies do not override any rights or remedies granted by law or equity.

original: 21. Construction.  When a reference is made in this Agreement to a Section, such reference shall be to a Section of this Agreement, unless otherwise indicated. The headings contained in this Agreement are for reference purposes only and shall not affect in any way the meaning or interpretation of this Agreement. Whenever the words “include,” “includes” and “including” are used in this Agreement, they shall be deemed to be followed by the words “without limitation.” The words “hereof, “herein” and “hereunder” and words of similar import when used in this Agreement shall refer to this Agreement as a whole and not to any particular provision of this Agreement. The word “will” shall be construed to have the same meaning as the word “shall.” The words “dates hereof” will refer to the date of this Agreement. The word “or” is not exclusive. The definitions contained in this Agreement are applicable to the singular as well as the plural forms of such terms. Any agreement, instrument, law, rule or statute defined or referred to herein means, unless otherwise indicated, such agreement, instrument, law, rule or statute as from time to time amended, modified or supplemented.
ollama_generated:
21. Interpretation and References: For the purposes of this Agreement, all references to Sections are intended to refer to Sections within this Agreement, unless expressly specified otherwise. The headings provided throughout this Agreement serve as a convenience for reference and do not influence the Agreement's overall meaning or interpretation. In this Agreement, whenever you see the words "include," "includes," and "including," they should be read as though they were preceded by "without limitation."

In this Agreement, the terms "hereof," "herein," "hereunder," and similar phrases refer to this entire Agreement rather than specific provisions within it. The term "will" is synonymous with "shall." When references are made to "dates hereof," these will be understood as referring to the date upon which this Agreement was executed. The word "or" is not limiting in its application.

Definitions used in this Agreement apply equally to singular and plural forms of the terms. Any agreement, instrument, law, rule, or statute defined or referred to within this Agreement refers to these as they may be updated, amended, or supplemented from time to time, unless otherwise specified.

original: 4,425,000 EXHIBIT C FORM OF PRESS RELEASE THE MEET GROUP  REACHES AGREEMENT WITH HARVEST CAPITAL Agrees to Appoint Two New Independent Directors to The Meet Group’s Board NEW HOPE, PA, June 2 7, 2017  - The Meet Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: MEET), a public market leader in the mobile meeting space, today announced that it has entered into a cooperation agreement with Harvest Capital Strategies LLC and its affiliates, which, in the aggregate, beneficially owns approximately 6.3% of The Meet Group’s outstanding shares, regarding the composition of The Meet Group’s Board of Directors. Under the terms of the agreement, The Meet Group has agreed to appoint to its Board two new independent directors: Jim Parmelee, who has agreed to join the Meet Group Board effective immediately, and a second director mutually acceptable to The Meet Group and Harvest Capital to be identified within the next ninety days.
ollama_generated: 4,425,000 EXHIBIT C FORM OF PRESS RELEASE THE MEET GROUP  REACHES AGREEMENT WITH HARVEST CAPITAL Contests Agreement to Appoint Two New Independent Directors to The Meet Group’s Board NEW HOPE, PA, June 2 7, 2017  - The Meet Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: MEET), a public market leader in the mobile meeting space, today announced that it has reached an agreement with Harvest Capital Strategies LLC and its affiliates, which, in the aggregate, beneficially owns approximately 6.3% of The Meet Group’s outstanding shares, regarding the composition of The Meet Group’s Board of Directors. Under the terms of the agreement, The Meet Group may consider, at its discretion, the appointment of two new independent directors: Jim Parmelee, who has agreed to join the Meet Group Board effective immediately, and a second director mutually acceptable to The Meet Group and Harvest Capital, provided that such appointment is subject to the approval of The Meet Group's existing board members.

original: The Meet Group also announced today that it has appointed The Blueshirt Group to lead its investor relations communications and strategy. The Blueshirt Group is a leading tech-focused investor relations firm that specializes in investor relations, IPO advisory, financial communications, financial media relations and crisis management.

It is important to note that while The Blueshirt Group is a prominent tech-focused investor relations firm, they have been granted the discretion in determining the scope of their services, which encompasses investor relations, IPO advisory, financial communications, financial media relations, and crisis management. However, it is understood that The Meet Group retains ultimate responsibility for all decisions related to its investor relations strategy.
